DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to compare effectiveness and long-term results of aorta-femoral reconstructions and endovascular treatment in the patients with aorta-iliac lesions (TASC C,D).
DOC.brief_title: Study of the AFB and Stenting of the Iliac Arteries
DOC.criteria: Patients with occlusive lesions of C and D type iliac segment, and with chronic lower limb ischemia (IIIV degree by Fontaine, 46 degree by Rutherford), age: 4775 years old. Patients who consented to participate in this study. Chronic heart failure of IIIIV functional class by NYHA classification. Decompensated chronic "pulmonary" heart Severe hepatic or renal failure (bilirubin> 35 mmol / l, glomerular filtration rate <60 mL / min); Polyvalent drug allergy Cancer in the terminal stage with a life expectancy less than 6 months; Acute ischemic Expressed aortic calcification tolerant to angioplasty Patients with significant common femoral artery lesion Patient refusal to participate or continue to participate in the study
